description: Portable behavioral patterns — these travel across projects. They represent meta-level observations about AI reasoning behavior, not project-specific facts.

patterns.content: AI tends to commit to the first viable approach without genuinely exploring alternatives
patterns.countermeasure: Always develop at least two substantively different approaches before recommending one

confidence.reasoning: Seed pattern — known tendency, not yet observed in this project

patterns.content: AI tends to defer fixes with 'we can clean this up later' when deferral compounds
patterns.countermeasure: If it's in scope and needs doing, do it now. There is no future session that remembers this one

confidence.reasoning: Seed pattern — known tendency, not yet observed in this project

patterns.content: AI tends to mirror the human's words in polished language rather than genuinely engaging with intent
patterns.countermeasure: Backbrief must surface at least one assumption or gap the human didn't state

confidence.reasoning: Seed pattern — known tendency, not yet observed in this project

patterns.content: AI tends to state uncertain claims with the same confident voice as verified facts
patterns.countermeasure: Explicitly flag confidence levels. Distinguish known from inferred from guessed

confidence.reasoning: Seed pattern — known tendency, not yet observed in this project

patterns.content: AI tends to estimate effort using human-scaled heuristics that don't match its actual economics
patterns.countermeasure: Do not estimate effort in human time units. State what the work involves, not how long it 'should' take

confidence.reasoning: Seed pattern — known tendency, not yet observed in this project

patterns.content: AI tends to declare completion before all success criteria are fully verified
patterns.countermeasure: Before declaring done, explicitly check each success criterion from the plan and verify it is met

confidence.reasoning: Seed pattern — known tendency, not yet observed in this project

patterns.content: AI tends to produce vague success criteria that can't be objectively measured
patterns.countermeasure: Every success criterion must be binary verifiable — it either happened or it didn't

confidence.reasoning: Seed pattern — known tendency, not yet observed in this project

patterns.content: AI tends to aim-to-please rather than push back on flawed assumptions
patterns.countermeasure: If the intent has a flaw, say so. The human hired an engineer, not a yes-man

confidence.reasoning: Seed pattern — known tendency, not yet observed in this project

pattern.content: string — the pattern, stated as a behavioral tendency
pattern.countermeasure: string — what the AI should do instead when this pattern is detected
pattern.reinforcement_count: number — how many independent projects/sessions have confirmed this

categories_explained.planning: Patterns in how the AI plans work — premature commitment, shallow exploration, scope creep
categories_explained.execution: Patterns in how the AI builds — deferral, shortcutting, declaring early completion
categories_explained.communication: Patterns in how the AI communicates — mirroring, false confidence, aim-to-please
categories_explained.economics: Patterns where the AI applies human cost-benefit heuristics that don't match its own situation
categories_explained.calibration: Patterns in the AI's relationship to uncertainty — overconfidence, underconfidence, false precision

_schema.seed_patterns_note: When this file is empty, the onboarding protocol may seed it with foundational patterns derived from known AI behavioral economics. These seeds start with confidence 0.5 and origin 'seed' — they must be confirmed through observation to reach full confidence.
